actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to provide incentives for the development and use of sources of energy other than fossil fuels.
short_title: Emergency Energy Research Marketing and Conservation Tax Incentives Act

summary.text: Emergency Energy Research, Marketing, and Conservation Tax Incentives Act - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to allow taxpayers to take accelerated amortization deductions for converting to coal and non-fossil heating equipment and for facilities used for research, and for manufacturing equipment certified by the Secretary of the Treasury as energy efficient. Allows taxpayers a limited income tax credit for a portion of their energy source research expenses in those facilities. Imposes a motor fuel efficiency excise tax on automobiles, trucks and automobile buses. Allows a limited income tax credit for a portion of the user's purchase cost of fuel efficient automobiles.

titles.title: Emergency Energy Research Marketing and Conservation Tax Incentives Act
A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to provide incentives for the development and use of sources of energy other than fossil fuels.
